measured_by: Likert scale self-approval ratings collected after each triad of rounds
justification: "After each triad of 'rounds', participants were asked to give approval ratings of themselves…"

measured_by: Likert scale approval ratings of the partner collected after each triad
justification: The same sentence notes that participants also rated "their partner" using the approval scale immediately after each interaction set.

measured_by: Likert scale guess of how much the partner approved of them
justification: The task description states participants additionally reported "their guess about how much their partner approved of them."

measured_by: Amount of investment contribution chosen in the River Crossing (modified iterated Prisoner’s Dilemma) task
justification: "Participants decide how much to invest… Participants could choose among four intended levels of investment"—these contribution choices operationalise cooperation.

measured_by: Difference between self-approval and other-approval ratings
justification: Results section: "They approved more of themselves than of their partners, showing self-positivity biases," indicating the construct is quantified by comparing the two approval ratings.
